Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 81211: Hair, Nail, and Skin Care Services
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: failure to report defects in a timely manner
Info Source: http://www.cpsc.gov/en/Newsroom/News-Releases/2015/Office-Depot-Agrees-to-Pay-34-Million-Dollar-Civil-Penalty/

Description: Office Depot, Inc. paid the United States $4.75 million to settle allegations that it submitted false claims when it sold office supply products manufactured in countries not permitted by the Trade Agreements Act to United States government agencies.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2005/September/05_civ_483.html

Description: Office Depot, Inc. and two executives settled allegations of violating or causing violations of fair disclosure regulations when selectively conveying to analysts and institutional investors that the company would not meet analysts' earnings estimates. The SEC also accused Office Depot with unrelated accounting violations.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2010/2010-202.htm

Description: overtime violation
Private Litigation Case Title: Pritchett, Romia Vs. Office Depot Inc
Info Source: http://caselaw.findlaw.com/us-10th-circuit/1392919.html

Description: Office Depot, Inc. and a California-based tech support software provider agreed to pay a total of $35 million to settle Federal Trade Commission allegations that the companies tricked customers into buying millions of dollars' worth of computer repair and technical services by deceptively claiming their software had found malware symptoms on the customers' computers.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2019/03/office-depot-tech-support-firm-will-pay-35-million-settle-ftc

Description: Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., and its affiliate, Wal-Mart.com, Inc.; Target Corporation and its affiliate, Target.Direct, LLC; and Office Depot, Inc., and its affiliate Viking Office Products, Inc. paid a total of $2,411,714 in taxes they failed to collect because they argued the dot-coms were separate companies not located in Illinois. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally among Wal-Mart, Target and Office Depot.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20041222061833/http://www.ag.state.il.us//pressroom/2004_12/20041210b.html

Description: Office Depot agreed to pay $189,000 in restitution in settlement of allegations it overcharged government and non-profit customers by misrepresenting and failing to be be forthcoming about cost savings in their sales and marketing.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20150921175219/http://www.coloradoattorneygeneral.gov/press/news/2011/06/06/attorney_general_announces_settlement_office_depot_resolve_allegations_overbil
Attorney General Reaches $4.5 Million Settlement with Office Depot for Florida Refunds, Targeted News Service, June 4, 2010 (via Nexis).

Description: Office Depot agreed to pay $320,000 in restitution and $120,000 in costs (with a $100,000 penalty suspended) in settlement of allegations it overcharged government and non-profit customers by misrepresenting cost savings.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20120325071608/http://ago.mo.gov:80/newsreleases/2010/Attorney_General_Koster_announces_judgment_in_Office_Depot_case_company_pays_320_000_restitution_/
https://web.archive.org/web/20160820064213/http://ag.ny.gov/press-release/ag-schneiderman-announces-475000-settlement-office-depot-overcharging-new-york-state
Attorney General Petro Resolves Hundreds of Complaints in Settlement with OfficeMax, US States News, September 20, 2005 (via Nexis).

Description: deceptive consumer repair sales practices
Info Source: https://www.atg.wa.gov/news/news-releases/ag-ferguson-office-depot-will-pay-900000-over-deceptive-virus-screening

Description: Office Depot agreed to pay over $2.5 million in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys of Marin, Sonoma, Santa Clara, Ventura, Solano, Napa, Shasta, Sacramento, and Los Angeles counties, and the City Attorney of the City of Los Angeles that it overcharged customers through inaccurate pricing at its checkout scanners.
Info Source: https://www.sccgov.org/sites/da/newsroom/newsreleases/Pages/NRA2009/Office-Depot-settles.aspx

Description: Office Depot agreed to pay $4.25 million in settlement of allegations it overcharged San Francisco by failing to provide contractually mandated discounts on items ordered by the city.
Info Source: https://www.sfcityattorney.org/2010/12/14/herrera-reaches-4-25-million-settlement-agreement-in-office-depot-overcharge-case/
